Comments_Questions: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload  (amount of time required to prepare, in relation to the subject area and content)

Comments_List: I believe the workload is perfect. I learned a lot from both the class and the reading/writing assignments. Maybe more examples could be provided for writing assignments such as the budget writing, for examples provided in other courses might couldnt be directly used in this course.

Though I'm not sure what "website" refers to in this course, I am enjoying the organization of it. Im looking forward to the advance class and I believe it is on the same track as the beginner class. Maybe a vocabulary of the terms in this field could be provided in the beginning. Being a student without professional background, I spent some time search for the terms and guessing the difference between similar ones. Though this procedure was helpful, it would be better if there is an official clarification of the terms.

I appreciate the semester with Professor Hamingson. He is always well prepared and energetic. And he responses actively to all the questions. Maybe there could be more classes for each semester for deeper understand of the field.
There was no visitor for the course.

Andy is a skilled fundraiser but unfortunately, he lacked the presence and passion to make the class engaging and dynamic. Most of the class was very New York centered and I felt like he only really considered what the more NY-savvy students in the class had to say. I'm afraid to say that I was not satisfied with this course.
I enjoyed every minute in the class. The reading and writing assignments work well together, and they are helpful for my learning as well.
It would be better if there are more classes during the semester, maybe once a week instead of every two weeks.
